            "title": [
              ["Just like the "],
              ["if", [["c"]]],
              [" statement, when the block within "],
              ["if", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["else", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is consisting of only one statement, then the braces can be omitted (but doing so is not recommended as it can easily introduce problems involuntarily). However if thereâ€™s more than one statement within the "
              ],
              ["if", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["else", [["c"]]],
              [
                " block, then the braces have to be used on that particular block."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1

            "title": [
              ["While "],
              ["if", [["c"]]],
              [" performs an action only when its condition evaluate to "],
              ["true", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["if", [["c"]]],
              [" / "],
              ["else", [["c"]]],
              [
                " allows you to specify the different actions when the condition "
              ],
              ["true", [["c"]]],
              [" and when the condition is "],
              ["false", [["c"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
